sentences: Jacob Anthony Perez (born April 21, 1996), known professionally as Princeton Perez is an American singer-songwriter, professional dancer, and actor.
section: N/A

sentences: Born and raised in Downey, California, near Los Angeles, Perez began his career at a young age when he appeared in television advertisements for companies such as Nike, McDonald's, and Skechers.
section: N/A

sentences: He was included in two Gym Class Heroes music videos, including Shoot Down the Stars (as a young school child), and Cupid's Chokehold (as Cupid Boy).
section: N/A

sentences: Perez rose to fame as a member of the boy band Mindless Behavior, in which he remained from 2008 until the group's disbandment in 2017.
section: N/A

== Life and career == | === 2008–13: #1 Girl and All Around the World ===

sentences: Lakeisha Gamble, one of the contributing founders of Mindless Behavior, convinced future producer of the group, Walter Millsap, to form an American boy band.
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–13: #1 Girl and All Around the World ===

sentences: He was opposed to the idea at first, as explained in the film, Mindless Behavior: All Around the World.
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–13: #1 Girl and All Around the World ===

sentences: Along with Gamble and Millsap, there was Streamline Records head Vincent Herbert, who agreed on the concept of forming a boy band.
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–13: #1 Girl and All Around the World ===

sentences: Following the idea of forming the group, Gamble, Millsap, Herbert, songwriter Candice Nelson, and choreographer David Scott held open auditions in California in an attempt to find local boys that would fit the criteria of the group.
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–13: #1 Girl and All Around the World ===

sentences: Dave Scott, a choreographer who had previously worked with Princeton at Debbie Allen Academy, had been recommended to contact him for an audition.
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–13: #1 Girl and All Around the World ===

sentences: Gamble had seen him in a Gym Class Heroes video, "Cupid's Chokehold", portraying a young Cupid.
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–13: #1 Girl and All Around the World ===

sentences: Princeton had been called in to audition, and stated that he was "nervous" that he wouldn't get the part, as he did with every audition.
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–13: #1 Girl and All Around the World ===

sentences: Upon finishing the audition, he was told that he would hear back from them in two weeks, however, he got an approval the same night.
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–13: #1 Girl and All Around the World ===

sentences: Joining soon afterwards Princeton was Prodigy (Craig Crippen, Jr.), Roc Royal (Chresanto August), and Ray Ray (Rayan Lopez).
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–13: #1 Girl and All Around the World ===

sentences: Perez was named after Princeton University, due to his extensive knowledge in various music genres.
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–13: #1 Girl and All Around the World ===

sentences: For the next two years, they immersed themselves in music, developing their musical sound and style under the guidance of Herbert and Millsap.
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–13: #1 Girl and All Around the World ===

sentences: They moved in with their manager, Gamble, and began frequently rehearing dance routines, changing their diets, and getting to know one another.
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–13: #1 Girl and All Around the World ===

sentences: Teresa Perez, Princeton's mother, described it as a "boot camp" for each of the boys.
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–13: #1 Girl and All Around the World ===

sentences: Gaining their performance repertoire, they put on shows at local schools on the CLASSCFIED High School Tour.

sentences: This helped them gain fans and recognition, along with their YouTube channel that held their creative "MB Cam" and Ustream account.

sentences: Soon afterwards, Interscope Records chairman Jimmy Iovine signed Mindless Behavior to the label.
